summary: Prolonged conflict leads to widespread destruction, loss of life, and devastation of infrastructure, highlighting the severe consequences of war.
The recognition of the immense damage caused by conflict prompts leaders to reconsider their priorities and seek reconciliation.
Former adversaries decide to repair their relationships, emphasizing the importance of cooperation and understanding over hostility.
In the aftermath of conflict, countries choose to face challenges together, demonstrating the power of unity and collective resilience.
The decision to prioritize peace over power struggles marks the beginning of a new era focused on friendship and cooperation.
